headline: Trump’s Revenge Summer Heats Up With Fed Ouster, Bolton Raid
summary: The president is following through with his promise to rain retribution on political opponents.  In recent weeks he’s stripped security clearances, launched investigations, used social media threats to intimidate adversaries — and even fired officials from agencies that operate independently from the executive branch.  When the Federal Bureau of Investigation raided the home of Trump’s former national security adviser-turned-critic John Bolton last Friday, it smacked of an escalation, even though the president denied he was personally involved and administration officials have said there are legitimate concerns about Bolton’s handling of classified material.

headline: Should Norfolk Southern’s (NSC) Downward 2025 Guidance Prompt a Strategic Rethink by Investors?
summary: Norfolk Southern recently reported second-quarter 2025 results showing improved cost control but railway operating revenues missed estimates, and the company lowered both its full-year revenue growth and operating ratio guidance. This update reflects ongoing economic uncertainty, weak liquidity, and tariff pressures, with analysts lowering earnings estimates and expressing less confidence in near-term performance. We’ll examine how Norfolk Southern's downward revision of 2025 guidance could...
